question_text: How does a PoE-capable switch determine whether a connected device should receive power?
answer_options: It checks the MAC address of the device
It requires manual configuration of power delivery
It performs an initial handshake to detect PoE compatibility
It automatically delivers power to any connected Ethernet device
correct_answer: It performs an initial handshake to detect PoE compatibility
explanation: PoE-capable switches use a detection mechanism (based on resistive sensing) to confirm that a connected device is PoE-compliant before delivering power, preventing accidental power delivery to unsupported devices.
